summary_markdown:
# About Quartet Health

Quartet Health is a value-based behavioral healthcare company founded on January 1, 2014, and headquartered in New York City. The company focuses on integrating behavioral and medical health through its Population Health Management platform, which facilitates communication and collaboration between medical and behavioral health providers. This approach aims to improve patient care quality by addressing gaps in care and enhancing network quality driven by behavioral and medical comorbidities [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

Quartet Health operates in 39 states and partners with health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers to provide comprehensive behavioral health solutions. The company offers services such as therapy, psychiatry, and digital options to improve mental health care access and delivery [(Quartet Health)](https://www.quartethealth.com/). Quartet Health's business model is primarily B2B, collaborating with various health plans and systems to streamline mental health care access [(Health Systems)](https://www.quartethealth.com/health-systems/).

The company has raised a total of $265 million across multiple funding rounds, with notable investors including Google Ventures, Polaris Partners, and Centene Corporation [(Crunchbase, 2024)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/quartet-health). Quartet Health's recent financial performance and strategic partnerships, such as the one with Clover Health, position it as a leader in the behavioral health space [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

# Key Personnel

- **Puneet Singh**: CEO of Quartet Health. He has a robust background in healthcare, having previously held the position of Chief Growth Officer at Anthem and played a significant role in the growth of Aspire Health. His experience includes private equity investment and corporate strategy in healthcare, starting his career as an investment banker at Goldman Sachs [(About Us)](https://www.quartethealth.com/about-us/).

- **Christina Mainelli**: CEO of Quartet Health, highlighted the need for a holistic approach to healthcare for individuals with serious mental illness (SMI) [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

- **Dr. Michael J. Lipp**: Chief Medical Officer, emphasized the importance of coordinated care for patients with serious mental illness [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

- **Karen Mitchell**: Recently announced as Chief Growth Officer [(Quartet Health, 2024-02-15)](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/quartet-health-announces-karen-mitchell-as-chief-growth-officer-302062185.html).

# News

## Recent Developments

### New Product Launch

On March 19, 2024, Quartet Health announced the launch of its Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health. This program aims to provide a comprehensive care delivery solution for patients with serious mental illnesses by integrating physical and behavioral health services. The program offers 24/7 care access, medication support, and care coordination [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

### Acquisition

In 2021, Quartet Health acquired innovaTel, a telepsychiatry provider, to enhance its service offerings and improve access to mental health care [(Remote Quartet Health/Customer Support Specialist)](https://careervault.io/remote/quartet-health-298/support/customer-support-specialist-est-remote-united-states-5056576).

## Partnerships

Quartet Health's partnership with Clover Health is a significant development, allowing the company to leverage Clover's resources to better serve underserved populations with serious mental illnesses. This collaboration aims to create a more integrated healthcare experience for patients [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Financial Performance and Scale

Quartet Health has raised a total of $265 million, reflecting strong investor confidence in its business model and growth potential. The company ranks second among 43 active competitors in the behavioral health sector [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

## Employee Insights and Culture

Quartet Health promotes a collaborative and innovative work environment, emphasizing a patient-first approach. The company is committed to diversity and inclusion, actively encouraging applicants from various backgrounds to apply for positions [(Senior Actuarial Analyst - Quartet Health)](https://www.builtinnyc.com/job/actuary/286127).

# Conclusion

Quartet Health is making significant strides in the behavioral healthcare sector through innovative programs and strategic partnerships. The recent launch of the Whole Health program and the acquisition of innovaTel position the company well to address the complex needs of patients with serious mental illnesses. With strong financial backing and a commitment to integrated care, Quartet Health is poised for continued growth and impact in the healthcare landscape.

webpage_result.summary_markdown:
# Quartet Health Summary

## Company Overview
Quartet Health is a leading value-based behavioral healthcare company focused on expanding access to high-quality care for individuals with behavioral health needs, including serious mental illness. The company operates in 39 states and partners with health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers to provide comprehensive behavioral health solutions. Their innovative approach aims to navigate the complex mental health landscape, ensuring that patients receive the care they need [(Quartet Health)](https://www.quartethealth.com/).

## History and Leadership
Puneet Singh serves as the CEO of Quartet Health. He has a robust background in healthcare, having previously held the position of Chief Growth Officer at Anthem and played a significant role in the growth of Aspire Health. His experience includes private equity investment and corporate strategy in healthcare, starting his career as an investment banker at Goldman Sachs [(About Us)](https://www.quartethealth.com/about-us/).

## Services and Products
Quartet Health offers a range of services designed to improve mental health care access and delivery:

- **Therapy**: Weekly sessions with therapists, available in-person or virtually, to help individuals manage their thoughts and feelings.
  
- **Psychiatry**: Access to psychiatrists for medication management and treatment planning, with options for in-person or virtual appointments.
  
- **Digital Options**: Online programs that provide tools for managing symptoms like stress and anxiety, accessible via phone, computer, or tablet.

These services are tailored to meet individual clinical needs and preferences, ensuring a holistic approach to mental health care [(What Kind of Mental Health Care Options Can I Access Through Quartet?)](https://www.quartethealth.com/resources/care-options/).

## Customers and Partnerships
Quartet Health collaborates with various health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers. Notable testimonials from healthcare professionals highlight the effectiveness of Quartet's solutions in improving patient access to mental health care and streamlining the referral process [(Health Systems)](https://www.quartethealth.com/health-systems/).

## Culture and Diversity
Quartet Health emphasizes a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI). The company fosters a supportive environment through employee resource groups that reflect its commitment to DEI. Quartet aims to build products that prioritize health equity, ensuring that all patients can access the best mental health care available [(Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Quartet)](https://www.quartethealth.com/dei/).

## Conclusion
Quartet Health is dedicated to transforming behavioral healthcare through innovative solutions, strong partnerships, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion. Their focus on whole-person care and accessibility positions them as a leader in the mental health space, striving to ensure that every individual receives the care they need.

# [Quartet Health on 2024-09-20](https://www.quartethealth.com/)
Quartet Health is an industry-leading value-based behavioral healthcare company. We expand access to and deliver high-quality care for people with behavioral health needs, including serious mental illness. Quartet’s care enablement and delivery offerings seek to improve the lives of patients by providing whole, human, behavioral health care to those in need.

Our innovative approaches to navigating the complex mental health landscape enable us to identify, engage, and care for patients and deliver an end-to-end behavioral health solution. We are a trusted partner of health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers that serve patients in 39 states across the country.

# [Quartet Health on 2021-08-06](https://www.quartethealth.com/security/)
At Quartet, we recognize the highly sensitive nature of data entrusted to us by our partners. We also recognize the regulatory requirements set forth by HIPAA / HITECH and industry best practices and standards (e.g., AICPA Trust Services Principles and ISO27001/ 2) and strive to meet and exceed those requirements. The goal of this Security Statement is to ensure transparency regarding our security practices, and to help reassure you that your data is appropriately protected.

You may report security issues to us at [email protected]

Quartet utilizes Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) in order to take advantage of the elasticity, reliability and security of the AWS Infrastructure as a cloud service.

All data is stored and processed through AWS’ certified-secure facilities:

AWS hosting facilities are SOC Type 1 & 2 certified and certified to meet ISO standards

AWS hosting facilities accessible only by biometric scanning

24/ 7 monitoring by security guards

24/ 7 video surveillance

# [Quartet Health on 2020-08-27](https://www.quartethealth.com/privacy-policy/)
As described in this Privacy Policy, we may collect certain personal information from or about you in connection with your use of, or your acceptance of, the Services. Personal information, for purposes of this Privacy Policy, generally includes information that may be used to identify you. The types of personal information we collect about you will depend on your relationship with Quartet. You are not required to provide all personal information identified in this Privacy Policy; however, please be advised that if you do not provide the personal information requested by us, including personal information necessary to respond to customer inquiries, we may be unable to provide some or all of the Services to you. In some cases, and if applicable, we may request additional consent from users if we think there is other information that will improve our ability to coordinate care or tailor our services to the needs of our users.

Marketing and informational communications.

If you have provided your contact information to us, we may store and use that information to contact you for marketing and promotional purposes by various means, including regular mail, email, telephone, voicemail, or SMS (text message). Users may receive messages about appointment reminders, general health care information and wellness programs sponsored by Quartet. You can recognize when an affiliated business is associated with our services, and we will only disclose your Personal Information with that affiliated business to the extent that it is necessary for the delivery of the transaction or service.

We may receive a confirmation when you open an email from us. This confirmation helps us make our communications with you more interesting and improve our services. To the extent permitted by law, and if you have provided your contact information to us, we may store and use that information to contact you about the coordination of your care by various means, including regular mail, email, or telephone, including voicemail or SMS (text message). To the extent you voluntarily opt to have SMS notifications sent directly to your mobile phone, we receive and store the information you provide, including your telephone number. You can adjust the types of notifications you receive and when you receive them by editing your SMS notification settings. We may also use your information to notify you about appointments and/or to communicate with you about your Account. You will have the ability to opt out of any marketing or advertising communications, but we may still send you communications relating to your Account for purposes important to the Services, such as password recovery.

We do not rent or sell your personal information. We may disclose your personal information with third parties as described in this section.

We may de-identify Personal Information so that a user is not identified as an individual, and provide that information to our partners. We may also provide aggregate usage information to our partners (or allow partners to collect that information from our users), who may use such information to understand how often and in what ways people use our Services, so that they, too, can provide an optimal online experience.

We will retain a user’s information for as long as the Account is active or as needed to provide our services to the user, in accordance with applicable law. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, we will retain, access, use and disclose information as we believe is necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, enforce our Terms of Use and other agreements, or to protect the rights, property or safety of Quartet, our employees, our users or others.

The Website’s use cookies and similar technologies to improve user experience, for performance and analytics, and to improve our content, products, and services.

A “cookie” is a small text file that a web server stores in browser software. A browser sends cookies to a server when the browser makes a connection to the server (for example, when requesting a web page from the same domain that created the cookie). The purpose of cookies is to remember the browser over time and distinguish one browser instance (or user) from all others. Some cookies and other technologies may serve to track personal information previously entered by a web user on the Website. Most browsers allow you to control cookies, including whether or not to accept them and how to remove them. Cookies can remember login information, preferences, and similar information.

Cookies, as well as other tracking technologies, such as HTML5 local storage, and Local Shared Objects (such as “Flash” cookies), and similar mechanisms, may record information such as a unique identifier, information you enter in a form, IP address, and other categories of data. We may also use web beacons or “pixels,” and in certain circumstances may collect IP address, screen resolution and browser software and operating system types, clickstream patterns, dates and times that our site is accessed, and other categories of data.

If you want to block the use and saving of cookies from the Website on to the computer’s or other electronic device’s hard drive, you should take the necessary steps within your web browser’s settings to block all cookies from the Website and external serving vendors, or use the cookie control system, if available upon first visit, which is available here. Please note that if you choose to erase or block your cookies, certain parts of our Website may not function correctly. For information on how to disable cookies, refer to your browser’s documentation.

We may also use what is known as “client-side page tagging,” which uses code on each page to write certain information about the page and the visitor to a log when a page is rendered by your web browser. This technique is also commonly used on commercial websites. “Tagging” does result in a JavaScript program running on your computer, but it is limited to providing information about the page that you are requesting and the configuration of your browser. It will not read any of your data files, or execute any additional programs. It does not extract any personal information about you, such as your name or address. You can prevent tagging by disabling JavaScript in your browser, but that may prevent you from using all of our Website’s functions.

Quartet may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. When material updates are made, the Privacy Policy version date will also be updated to reflect that a revision occurred, and we will alert you to changes by placing a notice on www.quartethealth.com, by sending you an email, and/or by some other means. We encourage you to periodically reread this Privacy Policy to see if there have been any changes that may affect you. A user is bound by any changes to the Privacy Policy when using the Website or Services after such changes have been first posted. This Privacy Policy is not intended to and does not create any contractual or other legal rights in or on behalf of any party.

# [Quartet Health on 2020-05-27](https://www.quartethealth.com/about-us/)
Puneet Singh serves as CEO of Quartet Health. Prior to joining Quartet, Puneet was the Chief Growth Officer for the Diversified Business Group at Anthem, where he was responsible for the external growth of the division, including AIM, Aspire, Beacon Health Options, CareMore, HealthGuide, and other businesses. He joined Anthem through the acquisition of Aspire Health, where he served as Chief Development Officer and helped grow the business from a startup to the nation’s largest provider of community-based palliative care.

Earlier in his career, Puneet was a private equity investor and also served as a Vice President at Accretive Health, where he led corporate strategy, marketing, and communications for the company. Puneet began his healthcare career as an investment banker at Goldman Sachs, where he worked on a range of M&A and capital markets transactions in the healthcare industry.

He is a graduate of the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

# [What Kind of Mental Health Care Options Can I Access Through Quartet? on 2020-10-08](https://www.quartethealth.com/resources/care-options/)
At Quartet, our vision is that one day, every person with a mental health condition will get the care they need. No one’s experience with mental health is the same – different people have different needs, not just clinically, but in terms of access, too.

Getting people the mental health care they need calls for a range of mental health care options. Below, you can learn more about the care options* available through Quartet.

Therapy

A therapist helps you to talk through your thoughts and feelings. This may be related to handling difficult experiences, solving problems, changing behavior or learning how to manage stress.

Therapy sessions are usually offered weekly for 45-60 minutes, and can either be in-person or virtual. Virtual sessions can be over the phone or video conferencing. How long you choose to attend therapy will vary depending on your individual needs and goals.

Psychiatry

A psychiatrist is a doctor who is trained and specializes in treating mental health conditions using medication. Psychiatrists will talk through your symptoms, create a treatment plan, explain medication options, and keep track of your progress.

Psychiatry appointments may be in-person or virtual, depending on the patient. Virtual sessions can be over the phone or video conferencing. First appointments may be between 45-60 minutes and follow up appointments are shorter and less frequent. Many people who see a psychiatrist also see a therapist.

Digital Options

Online programs allow you to access care wherever you are, at your convenience and help you manage symptoms like stress, anxiety, or sadness using tools that help you change behaviors and improve your outlook. These programs are goal-oriented and can be done on your own or with the support of an optional coach. Online programs are often accessible by phone, computer or tablet.

*The mental health care options available to you will depend on your clinical needs, preferences, and insurance. Policies regarding in-person or virtual care are subject to change, and it is recommended that you verify coverage with your insurance plan.

Anything you post, upload, share, store, or otherwise provide through the Services is your “User Submission.” You promise to abide by all copyright notices, trademark rules, information, and restrictions contained in any Content you access through the Services, and you won’t use, copy, reproduce, modify, translate, publish, broadcast, transmit, distribute, perform, upload, display, license, sell or otherwise exploit for any purpose any Content not owned by you, (i) without the prior consent of the owner of that Content or (ii) in a way that violates someone else’s (including Quartet’s) rights.

We’re always trying to improve the Services, so they may change over time. We may suspend or discontinue any part of the Services, or we may introduce new features or impose limits on certain features or restrict access to parts or all of the Services. We’ll try to give you notice when we make a material change to the Services that would adversely affect you, but this isn’t always practical. Similarly, we reserve the right to remove any Content from the Services at any time, for any reason (including, but not limited to, if someone alleges you contributed that Content in violation of these Terms), in our sole discretion, and without notice.

Consistent with our Privacy Policy, some of our Services may allow you to receive SMS (text) notifications from us. Users may receive messages about appointment reminders, general health care information and wellness programs sponsored by Quartet. To the extent you voluntarily opt to have SMS notifications sent directly to your mobile phone, we receive and store the information you provide, including your telephone number. You can adjust the types of notifications you receive and when you receive them by editing your SMS notification settings. We may also use your information to notify you about appointments and/or to communicate with you about your Account.

To the extent your SMS notification settings permit us to send SMS messages to your mobile phone, the following terms apply:

In addition to any fee of which you are notified, your mobile provider’s standard messaging rates apply to our SMS correspondence. You may choose to receive Quartet mobile SMS alerts by signing up. Message and data rates may apply, according to your individual rate plan provided by your wireless carrier. Please consult your mobile service carrier’s pricing plan to determine the charges for browsing data and sending and receiving SMS messages. Under no circumstances will Quartet, or its affiliates be responsible for any SMS messaging or wireless charges incurred by you or by a person that has access to your wireless device or telephone number. If your carrier does not permit SMS messages, you may not receive the Quartet SMS alerts. Pre-paid phones or calling plans may not be supported. You may receive a bounceback message for every message you send to us.

We will not be liable for any delays in the receipt of any SMS messages, as delivery is subject to effective transmission from your network operator. SMS message services are provided on an AS IS basis. Data obtained from you in connection with this SMS service may include your cell phone number, your provider’s name, and the date, time, and content of your messages or as otherwise provided in our Privacy Policy. We may use this information to contact you and to provide the Services you request from us. We will never share this information with a third party, except as expressly provided in our Privacy Policy.

When you opt-in to the service, we will send you an SMS message to confirm your signup.

You can cancel the SMS service at any time. Just text “STOP” to (877) 258-4010. After you send the SMS message “STOP” to us, we will send you an SMS message to confirm that you have been unsubscribed. After this, you will no longer receive SMS messages from us. If you want to join again, just sign up as you did the first time and we will start sending SMS messages to you again.

If at any time you forget what keywords are supported, just text “HELP” to (877) 258-4010. After you send the SMS message “HELP” to us, we will respond with instructions on how to use our Service as well as how to unsubscribe.

We are able to deliver messages to the following mobile phone carriers: Major carriers: AT&T, Verizon Wireless, Sprint, T-Mobile, MetroPCS, U.S. Cellular, Alltel, Boost Mobile, Nextel, and Virgin Mobile. Minor carriers: Alaska Communications Systems (ACS), Appalachian Wireless (EKN), Bluegrass Cellular, Cellular One of East Central IL (ECIT), Cellular One of Northeast Pennsylvania, Cincinnati Bell Wireless, Cricket, Coral Wireless (Mobi PCS), COX, Cross, Element Mobile (Flat Wireless), Epic Touch (Elkhart Telephone), GCI, Golden State, Hawkeye (Chat Mobility), Hawkeye (NW Missouri), Illinois Valley Cellular, Inland Cellular, iWireless (Iowa Wireless), Keystone Wireless (Immix Wireless/PC Man), Mosaic (Consolidated or CTC Telecom), Nex-Tech Wireless, NTelos, Panhandle Communications, Pioneer, Plateau (Texas RSA 3 Ltd), Revol, RINA, Simmetry (TMP Corporation), Thumb Cellular, Union Wireless, United Wireless, Viaero Wireless, and West Central (WCC or 5 Star Wireless). Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages.

As always, message and data rates may apply for any SMS messages sent to you from us and to us from you. Message frequency varies. # Quartet Health, founded 2014-01-01 [(Crunchbase, 2024)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/quartet-health)
Quartet is a platform that makes it easier for people to get the best mental health care for them. The best care should fit their preferences and clinical needs, take their insurance, and link to the rest of their healthcare experience.

Quartet was founded in 2014 and is based in  New York, United States.

- [Website](http://www.quartethealth.com)
- [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/quartet-health/)
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/quartethealth)

## Funding (265M USD total)

- 51M USD on 2022-02-17
- 60M USD on 2021-12-02
- 7M USD on 2019-12-02
- 60M USD on 2019-06-14
- 40M USD on 2018-01-03
- 40M USD on 2016-04-14
- 7M USD on 2015-03-02

reviews.cons: Lots to learn. Multiple interlocking systems, lots of knowledge. Broad responsibilities. Good if you are easily bored.
reviews.pros: Good company. They care about their employees. What they do helps the world. Good pay and benefits. Unlimited PTO you can actually use. Great diversity.

reviews.advice: Offer coaching to all associates in C-suite, Senior Leadership, and in Executive Support to better align messaging and execution, as well as to provide cohesive understanding of business etiquette.
reviews.cons:
- There are some associates who do not pull their weight in comparison to others (same as everywhere).
 - There are a handful of developing leaders who do not credit contributors as they should, which causes occasional resentment.
 - The business is constantly changing, resulting in burnout for some associates.
reviews.pros:
- The vast majority of people working at Quartet Health are friendly, kind, and extremely hard-working. 
 - Leadership is dedicated to growing a successful company while improving the lives of the people in the Behavioral Health population. 
 - The salaries/benefits are competitive.
 - The teamwork in my area is probably the strongest and most supportive of any company I have ever worked at during my career.

reviews.advice: Not worth wasting the words. They don't care. This will be explained as just another "disgruntled former employee."
reviews.cons:
EVERYTHING else.
No co culture. Killed when they ousted the former CEO. ERGs are defunct - they laid off everyone involved over the course of two years. No one cares enough about the company or culture to try.
Management decreases benefits about every 6 months. Raises are paltry. Everything from company holidays to vacation time constantly stripped back for non-leadership employees. Ask someone about the Juneteenth or maternity leave debates. It will tell you everything you need to know.
Continue to claim "start up" status only because they are floundering for a strategy they can monetize. Total lack a consistent roadmap, because the strategy is changes yearly. 
Ever-increasing workload shoveled on the few employees not laid off with no increase in compensation or titles. Employee stratification undervalues everyone except leadership. Use that that to refuse to compensate employees for the additional work demanded of them.
Commitment to DEI is a lie, especially at the leadership level. All management hiring based on knowing the existing management team. Very white, hetero, male. Don't let the current female CEO fool you.
HR team tries, but they are handcuffed by leadership. As long as an employee is "producing" or part of the leadership circle, bad behavior is excused. Repeat offenders sit on the leadership team, and the people that reported leave rather than fight a losing battle. 
If you want real nightmares, know they laid off people on maternity/paternity leave, and laid off an employee that was literally weeks from her due date. That is the leadership you're getting here.
reviews.pros: Coworkers are some of the best. Dedicated to the mental health of their users.
reviews.summary: The bad reviews are real, no matter what management says

reviews.cons: Virtual-first working style isn't for everyone, but HR and leadership continue to find ways to foster a strong sense of community. There are regional meet-ups and budget for team building activities.
reviews.pros:
Quartet Health has a very mission & purpose-driven culture. The people who work here are passionate about improving access to quality healthcare for everyone. Each monthly all-employee Town Hall meeting starts with a Patient story to highlight the impact we're making in people's lives. Instances where employees demonstrate our Corporate values are also recognized each meeting.

There has been strong continuity among senior leadership the last few years and they have cast a compelling vision of the future to strengthen alignment at all levels on the pathway forward.
reviews.summary: Great place to make an impact in the communities we serve & grow your career

reviews.cons: -The only major con of working here has been some of the uncertainty with lay-offs last year... However, the whole industry experienced similar things, and Quartet has adapted well and is moving forward leaner and stronger than ever, allowing for more runway to "make it." And it seems we finally have the right people on board.
reviews.pros:
-A lot of smart and dedicated people work here. However, the culture is not overly stuffy and there is no air of pretentiousness like at some start-ups / growth stage companies
-The mission of expanding access to quality mental healthcare is at the core of the business and most of the employees care greatly about this
-The work is interesting, as there are multiple product lines and plenty of analytically interesting challenges to overcome, as with any business striving for maturation and sustainable profitability
-The business is fully remote, and work-life balance is good. Even in busy times with long hours for a period of time, the flexibility of being remote to take breaks during the day and get things done later makes it bearable long-term
reviews.summary: Good People, Great Mission, Interesting Work

reviews.advice: Keep up the great work! Continue to listen, be responsive, and value employees, clients, and patients as Quartet continues to grow. Staying flexible to respond to market needs and opportunities will ensure we remain successful.
reviews.cons: Honestly, I can't think of any major downsides to working at Quartet Health.
reviews.pros: Quartet Health is a fantastic place to work, and I get to work with a wonderful group of talented people. My direct leader creates a supportive environment, offering plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and growth, which makes me feel truly valued. The work we do here has a real impact, and it's incredibly rewarding to see the difference we make. Additionally, the senior and executive leadership genuinely listens to us, which is a rare and appreciated quality.
reviews.summary: A Great Place to Work with Amazing People

reviews.cons: Change can stress folks out. Its personally not a con for me but I know for others rapid change is difficult.
reviews.pros: The team is great in total. Whether its your direct team or working crossfunctionally, everyone is generally pleasant to work with. Its very flexible, everyone is understanding of work/life balance. Leadership is sharp.

reviews.cons: No L&D or benefits for learning,
reviews.pros: Committed leadership, good people overall

reviews.cons: Frequent management change and reorgs
reviews.pros: Lot of opportunities to grow

reviews.cons:
-No raise or cost of living adjustment in 2 years
-Do not know how to value employees.
-"Start up culture" (roll out new initiatives, not the best communication, focus on growth-but not on retention)
-Christmas Bonus was a certificate valued up to $20 to a website (options included 1 of the following: a pair of socks, a wick trimmer, wool dryer balls, a bar of fancy chocolate, a few tea bags, a 'boutique' car air freshener, and a few other miscellaneous items)
reviews.pros:
-Meaningful work
-Clinical leadership is solid

reviews.advice: Treat your employees like you use to. Most of the great talent has left or is going to leave. Why be the Walmart of digital health when you could be Target.
reviews.cons: In my time with the company they have slowly chipped away at the benefits package they offered. When I first started unlimited PTO was standard along with other great benefits. We recently have been told that we will no longer be receiving such a benefit. Along with that they have changed us from a salaried position to hourly. It is in my opinion that Quartet no longer cares about the employees who do the brunt of the work and are more about the bottom line. I’d think twice before apply here.
reviews.pros:
- Coworkers
- Working from home
- Mission Driven

reviews.advice: There isn’t any advice the management team hasn’t heard, acknowledged and IGNORED. Its completely pointless to bring anything up because it’s routinely ignored or turned around and blamed on Care Navigation.
reviews.cons:
9/2022 UPDATE: Quartet is now taking away our unlimited PTO and our salaried positions. They are moving all of the Care Navigation/ Customer Support Staff team to hourly positions. They have given us 9 days notice and we will go without full pay while they do this. Quartet Health is the WORST company I have ever worked for. They lie, make up fake laws and only pay or reward upper management. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT MENTAL HEALTH AT ALL. 


They continue to advertise “unlimited pto”. However this just isn’t true. If you’re a manager or above then yes, have at it. If you’re on the Care Navigation team or the Customer Support Staff who answer phones they will not give you time off. 
They count literally everyday you are off and have a point system for those who they deem unworthy to use their “unlimited pto”. It’s now the WORST Pto plan I’ve had in 20 years in health care. 

They have also taken our 15 holidays a year and reduced it to 6. Which is well below the National average for holidays allowed per year. 

The management staff have absolutely no idea how difficult the roles are speaking to the patients on a daily basis. The burn out rate is very high due to their unrealistic metrics. Also- most patients are not cared for simply because they have the “wrong” insurance and Quartet doesn’t get paid. This place is a complete waste of time for most patients and employees. If you want to feel like the sludge at the bottom of a pond, join Quartet!
reviews.pros: The pros are pretty simple, you work from home. Which in all honesty isn’t such a pro anymore with so many companies offering this. That’s the only pro.
reviews.summary: Quartet Health; the mental health company that cares NOTHING about mental health!

reviews.advice: For those that care, your best option is to leave and find new opportunities. This ship sank and is still sitting at the harbor. There is no true north and it is too late to course correct. For those that think this is a cash cow, keep up the good work-you will be the last ones standing.

Loss of salaries and benefits overnight with no warning, lack of transparency from the top down, and no accountability for the impact of layoffs. Many gave clear feedback during the last round of layoffs, which was completely disregarded by leadership yet again. The company does not value our efforts to make it easier for patients to connect to care. They are just focused on making money at this point, and it’s disappointing to see them cut corners to try to accomplish this. Truly unfortunate.

reviews.advice: Grow up. Listen to your employees. Let them know that they’re heard. Listen to your employees. Care about your employees. Listen to your employees.
reviews.cons: This company is inevitably sinking and no one wants to admit it. The management of the care navigation team is absolutely horrible. The managers have one way meetings and don’t allow care navigators or care support specialists to have voices. The team members are not allowed to ask questions during meetings and are told that if they do have questions to please go to their managers in their one-on-one meetings in private. Meanwhile, all of the Care navigation members talk crap about the managers in private slack groups. The morale of the team is incredibly low, the turnover rate is extremely high, and the managers “have no idea why.” When I started with quartet, the benefits were amazing and the morale of the team was high. But, gradually, the benefits have been taken away from the care navigation team and the work life balance absolutely sucks. Oh, but don’t worry, Care navigation managers get to keep their unlimited PTO, salaried wages, and great benefits. It’s in anyone and everyone’s best interest to avoid this sinking ship of a company. They have a great mission but they do an absolutely horrible job of executing it to patients in need of mental health services. Also, the cost of living has gone up and there’s been an increase in job responsibilities for the care navigation team, yet no increase in salary. If you’re looking for a job, look elsewhere. Trust me.
reviews.pros: My coworkers and remote job.

reviews.advice: It doesn’t matter. They don’t care. They’re probably trying to save even their own jobs! That’s how downhill it’s going.
reviews.cons: Here we go again, another round of unexpected lay offs. This company does not care about patients let alone employees. It’s all about money because they know they are going downhill. The CEOs, upper management and HR completely blindsided everyone else. The way they treated us when they did the lay offs last week was unbelievable, we weren’t given the opportunity to even say goodbye to co-workers who we’ve worked with for years! I truly feel like this company will no longer be around in a year. They are running out of money. Do yourself a favor and run far away from this place.

reviews.cons: WOW. Because WOW is the only reaction to how hypocritical this company is. They do not care about the mental health of their employees. Heartless and hypocritical are the only words I have for this company and everyone sitting in management. This is NOT the Quartet it used to be. The vision is blurred, most of the talent has left or been laid off and they do not care about patients who are not contracted with insurances Quartet makes money off of.

reviews.advice: Not worth wasting the words. They don't care. This will be explained as just another "disgruntled former employee."
reviews.cons:
EVERYTHING else.
No co culture. Killed when they ousted the former CEO. ERGs are defunct - they laid off everyone involved over the course of two years. No one cares enough about the company or culture to try.
Management decreases benefits about every 6 months. Raises are paltry. Everything from company holidays to vacation time constantly stripped back for non-leadership employees. Ask someone about the Juneteenth or maternity leave debates. It will tell you everything you need to know.
Continue to claim "start up" status only because they are floundering for a strategy they can monetize. Total lack a consistent roadmap, because the strategy is changes yearly. 
Ever-increasing workload shoveled on the few employees not laid off with no increase in compensation or titles. Employee stratification undervalues everyone except leadership. Use that that to refuse to compensate employees for the additional work demanded of them.
Commitment to DEI is a lie, especially at the leadership level. All management hiring based on knowing the existing management team. Very white, hetero, male. Don't let the current female CEO fool you.
HR team tries, but they are handcuffed by leadership. As long as an employee is "producing" or part of the leadership circle, bad behavior is excused. Repeat offenders sit on the leadership team, and the people that reported leave rather than fight a losing battle. 
If you want real nightmares, know they laid off people on maternity/paternity leave, and laid off an employee that was literally weeks from her due date. That is the leadership you're getting here.

reviews.cons: -The only major con of working here has been some of the uncertainty with lay-offs last year... However, the whole industry experienced similar things, and Quartet has adapted well and is moving forward leaner and stronger than ever, allowing for more runway to "make it." And it seems we finally have the right people on board.
reviews.pros:
-A lot of smart and dedicated people work here. However, the culture is not overly stuffy and there is no air of pretentiousness like at some start-ups / growth stage companies
-The mission of expanding access to quality mental healthcare is at the core of the business and most of the employees care greatly about this
-The work is interesting, as there are multiple product lines and plenty of analytically interesting challenges to overcome, as with any business striving for maturation and sustainable profitability
-The business is fully remote, and work-life balance is good. Even in busy times with long hours for a period of time, the flexibility of being remote to take breaks during the day and get things done later makes it bearable long-term
reviews.summary: Good People, Great Mission, Interesting Work

reviews.cons: Frequent management change and reorgs
reviews.pros: Lot of opportunities to grow

reviews.cons: No L&D or benefits for learning,
reviews.pros: Committed leadership, good people overall

reviews.advice: Keep up the great work! Continue to listen, be responsive, and value employees, clients, and patients as Quartet continues to grow. Staying flexible to respond to market needs and opportunities will ensure we remain successful.
reviews.cons: Honestly, I can't think of any major downsides to working at Quartet Health.
reviews.pros: Quartet Health is a fantastic place to work, and I get to work with a wonderful group of talented people. My direct leader creates a supportive environment, offering plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and growth, which makes me feel truly valued. The work we do here has a real impact, and it's incredibly rewarding to see the difference we make. Additionally, the senior and executive leadership genuinely listens to us, which is a rare and appreciated quality.
reviews.summary: A Great Place to Work with Amazing People

reviews.cons: Virtual-first working style isn't for everyone, but HR and leadership continue to find ways to foster a strong sense of community. There are regional meet-ups and budget for team building activities.
reviews.pros:
Quartet Health has a very mission & purpose-driven culture. The people who work here are passionate about improving access to quality healthcare for everyone. Each monthly all-employee Town Hall meeting starts with a Patient story to highlight the impact we're making in people's lives. Instances where employees demonstrate our Corporate values are also recognized each meeting.

There has been strong continuity among senior leadership the last few years and they have cast a compelling vision of the future to strengthen alignment at all levels on the pathway forward.
reviews.summary: Great place to make an impact in the communities we serve & grow your career

reviews.advice: Offer coaching to all associates in C-suite, Senior Leadership, and in Executive Support to better align messaging and execution, as well as to provide cohesive understanding of business etiquette.
reviews.cons:
- There are some associates who do not pull their weight in comparison to others (same as everywhere).
 - There are a handful of developing leaders who do not credit contributors as they should, which causes occasional resentment.
 - The business is constantly changing, resulting in burnout for some associates.
reviews.pros:
- The vast majority of people working at Quartet Health are friendly, kind, and extremely hard-working. 
 - Leadership is dedicated to growing a successful company while improving the lives of the people in the Behavioral Health population. 
 - The salaries/benefits are competitive.
 - The teamwork in my area is probably the strongest and most supportive of any company I have ever worked at during my career.

reviews.cons: Lots to learn. Multiple interlocking systems, lots of knowledge. Broad responsibilities. Good if you are easily bored.
reviews.pros: Good company. They care about their employees. What they do helps the world. Good pay and benefits. Unlimited PTO you can actually use. Great diversity.

# Employee Sentiments

## Reasons Employees Like Working at Quartet Health

### Positive Work Environment
- "The company is very mission driven and you can feel that in every interaction." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-08-08)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW67678095.htm)
- "Great people - Great opportunity for growth." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-05-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW76722464.htm)
- "The vast majority of people working at Quartet Health are friendly, kind, and extremely hard-working." [(Assistance (Undisclosed), Glassdoor, 2024-09-04)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW90704306.htm)

### Work-Life Balance
- "WLB was excellent." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2022-06-25)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65974385.htm)
- "The work environment is great. You have access to speak to senior leadership on a monthly basis and everyone is super friendly and willing to help." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-05-07)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW87046000.htm)

### Mission-Driven Culture
- "The mission of expanding access to quality mental healthcare is at the core of the business and most of the employees care greatly about this." [(Senior Manager, Glassdoor, 2024-06-20)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW88441725.htm)
- "Each monthly all-employee Town Hall meeting starts with a Patient story to highlight the impact we're making in people's lives." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-08-05)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW89796229.htm)

## Reasons Employees Dislike Working at Quartet Health

### Toxic Work Environment
- "The culture has tanked into a bottomless pit of toxicity." [(Manager, Glassdoor, 2022-03-14)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW61163940.htm)
- "The management of the care navigation team is absolutely horrible." [(Care Navigation, Glassdoor, 2023-01-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW72645233.htm)

### Poor Leadership and Management
- "Untrustworthy leadership (blatant lies)." [(Manager, Glassdoor, 2022-03-14)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW61163940.htm)
- "Lack of transparency from leadership." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2023-08-10)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW79043163.htm)

### Benefits and Compensation Issues
- "They have taken our 15 holidays a year and reduced it to 6." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2022-09-22)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW69354096.htm)
- "No raise or cost of living adjustment in 2 years." [(Clinician, Glassdoor, 2024-04-11)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW86243574.htm)

# [Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program to Improve Outcomes for Patients with Serious Mental Illness on 2024-03-19](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/)
Partnership with Clover Health Supports Underserved Patient Population With a New Whole-Person Care Delivery Solution

Quartet Health, a leading value-based behavioral health care enablement and delivery company, today launched their Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health, a physician enablement company, to better serve patients living with serious mental illnesses (SMI). The first-of-its-kind, whole-person care delivery solution is the only fully integrated physical and behavioral health model that takes accountability for the total cost of care (TCOC) risk on health plans’ most complex members, while also providing wraparound care services for a traditionally underserved patient population. The program was launched first in the New Jersey market.

“Patients with serious mental illness often have worse outcomes and a lower life expectancy, and they experience a fragmented healthcare system that does not adequately address their behavioral, physical, and social needs” said Dr. Michael J. Lipp, Quartet Health’s Chief Medical Officer, and former CMO of the CMS Innovation Center. Clover Health’s members with SMI average at least four different chronic conditions, with more than five different providers prescribing medications. Additionally, one in five members with SMI did not see a primary care physician (PCP) last year, and one in three did not see a behavioral health provider. “Patients often struggle to get access to care, and the care they do receive is often uncoordinated. This program will provide care that is coordinated, comprehensive and convenient, at no additional cost to patients.”

The partnership with Clover Health gives Quartet Health the opportunity to address the unique needs of this complex patient population with a health equity-based focus, through 24/7 care access, medication support, mental and physical care coordination, as well as local community resource and transportation support. Care teams – both in-market and virtual – will be led by nurse practitioners, trained in both mental health and family medicine, along with care coordinators, social workers, case managers, therapists, peers, and supervising psychiatrists and internal medicine physicians.

“For far too long, behavioral healthcare solutions for individuals living with SMI have not adequately accounted for the interconnectedness of both their physical and mental health needs,” said Christina Mainelli, Quartet Health CEO. “Patients are often forced to navigate an incredibly fragmented healthcare system, a system that fails to meet their needs, contributes to unnecessary hospitalizations and, ultimately, worse outcomes. That’s why it was so critical for us, in developing our Whole Health program, to take an approach that treats the whole person in a way that improves quality and patient outcomes, while also lowering the cost of care.”

“We’re confident that additional behavioral health support for our SMI cohort will increase the quality of life for these members, while continuing to reduce unnecessary spend,” said Brady Priest, CEO of Clover Home Care.

About the Role

We are seeking a skilled Senior Actuarial Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in actuarial analysis, particularly within the healthcare or insurance industry, and exposure to Medicare Advantage is a plus.

Role Responsibilities

Conduct actuarial analysis to support various business functions.

Data Analysis: Perform data analysis to support actuarial assumptions and decision-making processes.

Assist in the preparation and analysis of financial reports.

Forecasting and Budgeting: Support financial forecasting and budgeting efforts.

Work with cross-functional teams to support business objectives.

Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and guidelines.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices in actuarial methodologies.

Future success: Develop a solid grasp of actuarial processes, gradually identify and suggest improvements, and contribute to supporting business objectives and regulatory compliance as you build expertise and take on more complex responsibilities.

A bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.

A minimum of 3 years of actuarial experience, preferably in the healthcare or insurance industry.

You are pursuing Associate of the Society of Actuaries (ASA) designation..

You have experience with financial forecasting and budgeting.

You have a proficient level of programming skills, such as in SQL or R

Expert user of Excel

Proficiency in python programming

Consulting and/or Client management experience

​Annual learning & development budge​t

Improving upon our data reporting by collecting feedback from multiple stakeholders

Improving data quality of reporting though tests, refactoring, and reviews

Creating documentation for technical and nontechnical teams on reporting definitions and how to use the reports

Presenting reports and analytics to customers / internal stakeholders as needed

Owning business definitions sourced through our data pipeline

Care Enablement

Value-Based Care

Whole Health Care Delivery

Business Intelligence

Coursework in / experience with computer programming (irrespective of language)

Preferred Qualifications:

1-2 years of experience as a data analyst, consultant, banker, engineer, or in some other quantitative role

Coursework or experience writing SQL queries

Coursework or experience with data visualization tools / BI platforms (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.)

Coursework or experience related to Healthcare

Coursework or experience using Microsoft Excel (or Google sheets) to analyze data

Experience working with stakeholders to understand business problems and map abstract problems to data that can be used to solve them

Coursework or experience with the UNIX command line

# [Network Growth Specialist - Quartet Health](https://www.builtinnyc.com/job/network-growth-specialist/260204)
Company Description:

Quartet is a leading tech-enabled behavioral health company that works with health plans, systems, and provider groups to deliver speed to quality behavioral health care for all. Through sophisticated data and analytics, along with personalized services, Quartet exists to advance quality care as defined by four measures: speed to care, seamless patient experiences, improved health outcomes, and affordability for patients.

innovaTel is a leading telepsychiatry provider dedicated to improving access to exceptional psychiatric care. innovaTel partners with clinical organizations to provide a range of services to both adults and children including psychiatric evaluations, therapy, medication management, patient education and consultations. In 2021, Quartet acquired innovaTel, and together we are delivering on our shared mission of enabling speed to quality mental health care for all. We are deeply committed to growing a diverse team and an equitable and inclusive culture where all Quartetians are empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

About the team & Opportunity:

Quartet’s Network Transformation team is responsible for building a curated ecosystem of mental health providers and delivering value to our payer customers, which starts with building strong relationships in each of our markets. Specifically, the team is tasked with creating, implementing, and scaling Quartet’s Care Connections product and setting mental health providers up for long term success. Network Transformation works closely with teams across the organization to ensure continuous innovation which includes close collaboration with Customer, Market Operations, Care Navigation, Product, Clinical, and Data teams. Our approach is “partnership” rather than selling, to align on joint pain points, value, GTM strategy, and product capabilities. Our partnerships require someone who enjoys a fast-paced, innovative environment with daily client interactions, as we build and scale across the organization.

The Network Growth Specialist will serve as a valued resource for Mental Health Providers (MHPs) within a group of markets that have been implemented and onboarded with Quartet. The Network Growth Specialist is a trusted partner and point of contact for Quartet’s MHP partners, reporting into the Senior Network Transformation Manager and partnering closely with internal Quartet teams to deliver operational excellence, manage client interactions and operations, and identify and address areas for improvement to support Quartet’s ability to consistently deliver value. The Network Growth Specialist will be responsible for owning the operational components for the MHP to drive success within our payer customer contracts and get patients to care faster. Payer customers rely on Quartet to report back on important care events to understand how quickly their members get into care and their clinical progression over time.

Accountabilities:

Serve as the face of Quartet for any providers (both referring entities and mental health clinicians) seeking platform support and troubleshooting

Maintain network adequacy through a comprehensive understanding of the active MHP network, including but not limited to account oversight, profile management, and performance monitoring

Ongoing “quality over quantity” by verifying MHPs’ National Provider Identifiers (NPIs) and state licensures to guarantee members are treated by fully licensed professionals

Monitor platform compliance to ensure MHPs are providing timely and accurate updates about the status of Quartet referrals, including submitting information on behalf of the practice if needed

Manage supply of MHPs by regularly reviewing unresponsive providers and declined referrals to proactively confirm members are getting to care quickly

Support the Sr. Network Transformation Manager in MHP re-engagement for accounts that need a platform refresher and deactivation for accounts that are no longer meeting quality standards

Conduct MHP follow-up for any feedback and/or complaints provided to Quartet by patients, referring providers, or payers

Assist with onboarding and credentialing net-new MHPs as needed

Minimum Qualifications:

1-3 years of experience in a customer service or operational role

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage, build credibility, and create trust across all levels of an organization

Seek solutions beyond readily available information to meet providers’ unique needs

Strong data entry and data management skills, with impeccable attention to detail

​​Autonomous with demonstrated capability for problem solving, decision making, sound judgment, and assertiveness

Highly organized and effective at time management

Preferred Qualifications:

Previous experience working for a fast-paced start-up or healthcare consulting company

Flexibility and adaptability to accept the rapid changes inherent in Quartet’s growth-stage environment, with the ability to function independently and a bias towards action

A passion for expanding access to mental healthcare services

Previous experience with building new processes that require input from cross-functional teams in a project management, implementation, or related role

Highly proficient with MS office tools, especially PPT and Excel

Experience with Looker, or, similar BI tool

Experience working within a CRM system such as Salesforce

# [BHCOE Appoints New CEO; Former Optum Behavioral Health CEO Joins .406 Ventures by Morgan Gonzales on 2023-12-13](https://bhbusiness.com/2023/12/13/bhcoe-appoints-new-ceo-former-optum-ceo-joins-406-ventures/)
The Behavioral Health Center of Excellence’s founder passes CEO torch

The Behavioral Health Centers of Excellence (BHCOE), an autism treatment accreditation body, named Anya Perea, the company’s president, its new CEO.

Perea, who was educated and previously worked as a social worker, served as vice president of integrations at Refresh Mental Health before joining BHCOE.

“The opportunity to lead BHCOE in this next phase of the organization’s evolution is an immense honor,” Perea said. “Our success will be a result of aligned values and collaboration – not only within the BHCOE team, but within our larger community, including oversight committees, providers, parent groups, and individuals with autism.”

BHCOE develops voluntary consensus standards for applied behavior analysis (ABA) and autism treatment organizations.

The company’s founder, Sara Litvak, will remain an advisor to BHCOE.

Trip Hofer joins .406 Ventures as venture partner

The former CEO of Optum Behavioral Health Solutions, Trip Hofer, joined Boston-based health care venture capital firm .406 Ventures. Hofer also took on the CEO position at Redox, a health care software and .406 portfolio company, in October.

The new venture partner previously held leadership roles at AbleTo, CVS Health, UnitedHealth Group and Health Dialog.

“Working with Trip as an executive leader in our portfolio over the past 20 years has been both fun and successful,” Liam Donohue, co-founder and managing partner of .406 Ventures, said in a statement. “He is one of the most admired executives in U.S. healthcare and will add enormous domain and operating expertise to our investment work.”

Several of Hofer’s previous companies, including AbleTo andHealth Dialog, are .406 portfolio companies.

“We immediately formed a connection and a fluency of communication that has led to many successes,” Hofer said about managing partner Donohue. “We share a common vision and urgency for improving US healthcare. I look forward to working closely with .406 directly and through my new role as CEO of Redox.”

Path Mental Health builds out C-Suite with three new executives

Therapy and psychiatric service provider Path Mental Health recently onboarded a new chief commercial officer, chief operating officer and general counsel.

Path named Quartet Health vet Jay Meyers its new chief commercial officer. Meyers is tasked with overseeing payer partnership growth to expand the company’s covered lives as well as driving cost efficiency.

Meyers previously served as Anthem’s chief growth officer and Wellvana Health’s CEO.

Path tapped David Katcher as its chief operating officer. Katcher most recently worked as the chief operating officer of the hospitality platform AvantStay and previously held the position of head of global operations at Lyft. He will use his background in hyper-growth startups to expand services nationwide.

Tracey Scraba joined Path as the company’s first general counsel. Scraba most recently worked as deputy general counsel of Signify Health and previously served as chief privacy officer of CVS Health. She has also held executive roles at Aetna.

The company said that the new hires are coming on board at a “pivotal moment” for the organization as it looks to scale its services nationwide.

Youth mental health company Charlie taps two new executives

Bozeman, Montana-based Charlie hired a new chief product officer and head of digital innovation.

Udi Milo, the company’s new chief product officer, is tasked with delivering an “industry-leading mental health treatment experience to clients.”

Milo most recently co-founded and served as CEO of Fibo, a tech-enabled real estate company. He previously worked as vice president of product and growth at Tinder and head of product, driver and ride growth engagement at Lyft.

Donald Johnson will serve as Charlie’s head of digital innovation. Johnson previously worked at Optum in multiple roles, including chief architect of OptumInsight and chief technology officer of Optum’s State Government Solutions.

“Udi and Don’s innovative spirits and proven track records of solving complex challenges with inventive solutions make them the perfect additions to Charlie Health’s team,” Carter Barnhart, CEO and co-founder of Charlie Health, said. “I’m confident that their impact will further our efforts to address the nationwide mental health crisis we’re currently experiencing.”

Charlie’s offerings include individual therapy, family therapy and a virtual intensive outpatient program (IOP).

Compass Pathways names new chief financial officer

Compass Pathways (Nasdaq: CMPS) announced that Teri Loxam will serve as its chief financial officer, effective March 2024. Loxam will serve as an advisor until then.

Loxam previously worked as chief financial officer of Gameto, a biotechnology company, as well as the chief operating officer and financial officer of Kira Pharmaceuticals. She has served as a board member of vaccine company Vaxcyte and heart disease research and development company Cardiol Therapeutics.

“I am grateful for this opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the field of mental health and excited to bring my strategic, financial and operational expertise to the table, helping to steer the company towards continued success and innovation,” Loxam said in a LinkedIn post.

Loxam succeeds Mary-Rose Hughes, who will continue to serve as interim chief financial officer until Loxam’s tenure begins.

Behavioral health, SUD treatment company Flourish Behavioral Health hires new chief clinical officer

Flourish Behavioral Health named Angela Swolsky its chief clinical officer, according to a LinkedIn post.

Swolsky most recently worked as the director of program development at Tal Behavioral Health. She has also worked as a clinician at several other behavioral health companies.

“I’m pleased to announce that I’ve accepted the position of Chief Clinical Officer at Flourish Behavioral Health,” Swolsky announced via LinkedIn. “It’s an honor to collaborate with such dedicated and innovative professionals who share my vision and values of creating a positive and lasting impact in the behavioral health industry.”

Flourish offers partial hospitalization programs (PHPs) and IOPs, as well as outpatient, family counseling, medication assisted-treatment (MAT) and peer support services.

Substance use disorder treatment provider YourPath appoints new chief operating officer

Saint Paul, Minnesota-based YourPath hired Philip Rutherford as its new chief operating officer.

Rutherford previously worked as chief operating officer of advocacy organization Faces & Voices of Recovery. He has worked in nonprofit and for-profit technology sectors, In this new role he will lead YourPath’s expansion.

He has held positions on several national committees, including the National Institute of Health and the FDA.

“We are thrilled to announce that Philip Rutherford will be joining YourPath as our Chief Operating Officer,” read a post on YourPath’s LinkedIn page. “Phil has been a role model for many of us at YourPath over the years, demonstrating a commitment to innovation rooted in empowerment, equity and outcomes.”

YourPath’s services include MAT, care coordination, counseling, coaching and peer support.

# Comprehensive Analyst Report on Quartet Health

## Company Overview

Quartet Health is a value-based behavioral healthcare company founded in 2014 and headquartered in New York City. The company focuses on integrating behavioral and medical health through its Population Health Management platform, which facilitates communication and collaboration between medical and behavioral health providers. This approach aims to improve patient care quality by addressing gaps in care and enhancing network quality driven by behavioral and medical comorbidities [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

As of December 2020, Quartet Health had approximately 257 employees [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek). The company has raised a total of $222 million across seven funding rounds, with its latest Series E round in December 2021, which secured $60 million [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek). Notable investors include Google Ventures, Polaris Partners, and Centene Corporation [(Senior Actuarial Analyst - Quartet Health)](https://www.builtinnyc.com/job/actuary/286127).

## Recent Developments

### New Product Launch

On March 19, 2024, Quartet Health announced the launch of its Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health. This innovative program aims to provide a comprehensive care delivery solution for patients with serious mental illnesses (SMI) by integrating physical and behavioral health services. The program is designed to address the unique needs of this complex patient population, offering 24/7 care access, medication support, and care coordination [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

Dr. Michael J. Lipp, Quartet Health’s Chief Medical Officer, emphasized the importance of this initiative, stating, “Patients with serious mental illness often have worse outcomes and a lower life expectancy... This program will provide care that is coordinated, comprehensive and convenient, at no additional cost to patients” [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

### Acquisition

In 2021, Quartet Health acquired innovaTel, a telepsychiatry provider, to enhance its service offerings and improve access to mental health care. This acquisition aligns with Quartet's mission to deliver quality mental health care efficiently and effectively [(Remote Quartet Health/Customer Support Specialist)](https://careervault.io/remote/quartet-health-298/support/customer-support-specialist-est-remote-united-states-5056576).

## Partnerships

The partnership with Clover Health is a significant development for Quartet Health, as it allows the company to leverage Clover's resources to better serve underserved populations with SMI. This collaboration aims to create a more integrated healthcare experience for patients, reducing fragmentation in care delivery [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Company Leadership

Christina Mainelli, the CEO of Quartet Health, highlighted the need for a holistic approach to healthcare for individuals with SMI, stating, “For far too long, behavioral healthcare solutions for individuals living with SMI have not adequately accounted for the interconnectedness of both their physical and mental health needs” [(Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/). 

## Financial Performance and Scale

Quartet Health has positioned itself as a leader in the behavioral health space, ranking second among 43 active competitors in the sector [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek). The company’s total funding of $222 million reflects strong investor confidence in its business model and growth potential.

## Employee Insights and Culture

Quartet Health promotes a collaborative and innovative work environment, emphasizing a patient-first approach. The company is committed to diversity and inclusion, actively encouraging applicants from various backgrounds to apply for positions [(Senior Actuarial Analyst - Quartet Health)](https://www.builtinnyc.com/job/actuary/286127).

## Conclusion

Quartet Health is making significant strides in the behavioral healthcare sector through innovative programs and strategic partnerships. The recent launch of the Whole Health program and the acquisition of innovaTel position the company well to address the complex needs of patients with serious mental illnesses. With a strong financial backing and a commitment to integrated care, Quartet Health is poised for continued growth and impact in the healthcare landscape. 

For prospective candidates and investors, Quartet Health represents a promising opportunity in the evolving field of behavioral health, driven by a mission to improve patient outcomes and access to care.
